 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001YVvpCsY56W_FJepWyS4gYhpc-gMbPt_d5mZpBz16nehDoRrt6-YRxWx1oR7aN0UKp-FS3P_KiEIUOtxEyQmDRGHVZYpOf3Q8UYkP40NRT7svhO4vsDKOcxxaNyHtaPYBoiv7CDAnZwg=> .

 

Programmatic Hub

 

StubHub decided to cut out the middle man and build its own programmatic tech stack, as Digiday points out, which has led to more efficiency and cost savings. Lee Engel, StubHub's head of programmatic advertising, pointed out cutting agencies out of the picture won't work for every type of company. StubHub was already handling its own search ads, so it naturally progressed into handling its own display as well. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001YVvpCsY56W_6R8xeVsV4bHW2UzN6VmBRui9sA9gjVc6fIBy9NHQtkiLxrz7cXKjYXJLHxK1vSHy-QXvd6CY0PV-NMe5VglRvTENQ2biSNVKTtu7XZYiszDcKeYyAxk_dM8B2BmfuqFb5CbjQfnxgqN3JRSbJ9j1jzlitFmfIzTg6Hv789zGV_-f5WDc-XUOw> . Check out Joanna O'Connell's list of questions to ask before bringing programmatic in-house here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001YVvpCsY56W_DbkiePza0yCYx8l1e_nXWaxKP_gfvweDK4hekZJtFaaKcmilE3RNFdc_2Adbdsk37pZjDVwaVJT3yjQjGvqE4qvtxBdJg8KUaBWJj5nTVihYyTF1Fd5pXTcnVI0I45m2vNUZwKfxfWkg6DQA5_BRc7uhQ-Wmb6b4XsbI4NDH_pmO_Kpok6phzfZyITVZDze-dbVJU9FL81ZIzs9ijU1SP-rh2J2qVqb9ROvEqOMtTsQ==> .

 

DMP Troubles

 

Buried halfway through a feature on the state of iCrossing, Adweek's Chris Heine notes the search-centric agency has had a tough time extracting value from the DMP it bought in 2011. Depending on whom you ask, Red Aril (renamed Core Audience) 2011 is either an "empty shell" or "a huge part of our go-forth strategy." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001YVvpCsY56W9zutnfE9awcGwwI00kksHkQhydH9HbrmyFiQDFJC2AR_cyaHDvPk9LBCtnMaUxsoWcO-PmVGPYrQyn8FGtAcv4AoWuwoiO4IRzVfBWXtqLo4MDK6lkG9X8f3lv9FK6cnhsCZ9RVts0arB5Cbm-53x_PskH7Wwqon18NbuLClBH_zyX2dbgjHGrHeyjTCSLHJM=> .

 

Crossing The Channels

 

In a press release, sell-side platform PubMatic says that it has rolled out its video ad-serving technology and claims to provide "the industry's first cross-platform solution to deliver video advertising across display, mobile and tablet in real time." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001YVvpCsY56W_QbwWx7k8OZOzYjI-3g_U8bqOUMgicUrOJOFkR5RJfSB_gaWw70DjA6wb7OMypaDEdzWQGesHhA5cwwCcJ71lTuV5Ld2bcXUMh6vW9q3Fv77O1sgESVN664oHEJRAokWzjQ6w8IGoAS1B2PG1cA5COcKwEs_pRuEkqIZcJDilxW4swI4Slw7ju26409UGzXodMIW-KxaopkX4fsXteZu5Q7fRyG3RQ0CmheJGgaKHdhA==> .

 

The Native Year, Again

 

Native advertising was a hot buzzword in 2013, and Kunal Gupta, CEO of Polar, predicts in a column for Mobile Commerce Daily that its only going to heat up in 2014. Social companies have already based a lot of their ad model on native, especially since it performs so well on mobile. Publishers are starting to follow suit, and companies like BuzzFeed and Quartz are reaping the benefits of this new ad format. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001YVvpCsY56W-A6jqRru2FvEIhP9XWemku3axN76EHgtN6fBjBG2cGHSx2rw6aMxcx6n3gilyQgyHFPVRs1XA2YBJCPHafVcIPLBvE3ba9IsbWxkU_-37NAs6JszKVa1kYOF9nJSJ5XYPuUkwHJ312ENnDJzuctwvFp7jCSUVdWzQqAuZ2-jqSq5zcLI2xJSz2ljemy-YrS0m8XV-j3qWN68rUx2sc0rZOjcT9JZURga4=> .

 

Buying Clouds

 

According to VCCircle, IT outsourcing company Birlasoft has acquired CRM platform EnablePath for an undisclosed amount. EnablePath specializes in cloud computing and Salesforce.com gold cloud alliance partner. "Customers will benefit from the combined value of high-end cloud consulting services from EnablePath, along with global delivery and support capability from Birlasoft," said Riddle Ernie, president of EnablePath. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001YVvpCsY56W8rp868xGpEmC7iEUAZIJi0JSs2tH-ZGW84QxY5YOsF1_y8cYI-Qp5NB88D4T-UCCDxPIMcswIXWLQS2OqVQcDnhgHxsHt2DNujuIE2up4MOWINtUkp9eq-lCe2gCuO6aqbziim6Bz7LlK69xga6H7mqcOszoosA72SEw8Od5eKmQ9scnVWe5jGYcfgveh9A5vUBD6CQawX3a4Z9GZBajisYwnHb9pHBXHRjsG-R22kN8fRJN_UU74v> .


Facebook Acquires Branch

 

Facebook has agreed to acquire Branch and its sister service, the iPhone app Potluck, for $15 million. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001YVvpCsY56W_aZh01CzSK-opTZNsZaokyHC1n5uXpx9qS_orVp2NsdSW6TinvkW75lT7qVgrRgCQqUzPQpHCJsKofhQi5tHaKeBlJpCxmtuMDjnF0FdpaZptCvvbmoCc6JtGl9fGuAumvp6brc3fG0SKG4s9B98X8Mx75m_rRzVGDiwo_JLYhmu7hXaxsITi7nmK0kjh7XGwg1YfTW0N4crAFGIU0bnJ8LL9gj8vw5Qw=> . The Branch service is designed to curate online conversations to ensure that participants are knowledgeable and messages are relevant, thereby boosting engagement. In a Facebook wall post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001YVvpCsY56W8ReFq1jDzD9QhZFxaAIsz3xiVLp_GGcK0xolXnuWBFvlNm3w9OqGbaqRbyLUpqbdw90TZolPPVdMuRcdxCZZVTrYall33rrbFWVvQHwNIBIJfjcs8vTqp6VWV5gZwUFa3OMaXTOKH_16mXkezT_j_LJUQCKjJj-SY=> , Branch CEO Josh Miller said, "We will be forming Facebook's Conversations group, based in New York City, with the goal of helping people connect with others around their interests." He added that the nominal Branch and Potluck services will continue to exist outside of the Facebook venue.

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00107VHVOMNy6yFBqvDnxWGRaHNZP9mYj4l-x7uxowzfdlx_QXI47RTnZD3s6ZI5KFrWv0r2Aav16M_Qn2mWKJjg9UBXwBLCwBDBLjXhgcQQqa8ykuGn-nve10dIAMB0WWbFFiKxftqwa4=> .

 

Mobilizing Yahoo


Marissa Mayer's vision from a mobile-centric Yahoo is coming to fruition through its series of acqui-hires and app development. As VentureBeat reported, half of Yahoo's users are already on mobile, and its products, such as Mail and Weather, have been reinvented for the mobile age. Yahoo's recent acquisition of Aviate is all part of Mayer's vision for the mobile future. "We are convinced that the nature of search is changing, and what's happening on mobile devices - using context, anticipatory computing - is where we see [contextual mobile app launcher] Aviate going," said Yahoo mobile SVP Adam Cahan. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00107VHVOMNy6zIET_UinapwjGf37gv1udy9kN5QeSinistW4fnHm3bmPFkOvBggVEbG99CLNbJkGFq2ZuPLZxVU2tzkJ8p9UlqC-04GtKzSIC-lKqg7MCdGsXBCrPR3BWductIGoKFMzc67wePTPvJSWtSuRKM50jvoYTtDADwgXCArrAtldH1auqP4z7-HpZEtSm5eQDeSn8B8sCJHujqcMYWMm-ek-nRloUnqDS2sQM=> . Where do ads fit in the Yahoo mobile future? The jury is still out.


Testing Automation


The increasing mobile nature of social media has led companies like Twitter and Facebook to rethink how they develop and test their apps. Facebook in particular has decided to build out Airlock <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00107VHVOMNy6z_W7WHH74JT34Y5TmmerIZ8Q0hz0O_XEoqCObRqMs_pjkwNqZGpcQdmmAK33z12QzZUlJiHyJXtDhmRtpj_Ivs0h1_dnW3xNWk2VYgbmYBeJq-gv4-NzePsx7YLiE0leu7KZY_ndd0klT5yzkF8CQGnQxeyVNsVysBlCzb8Sg0Sj7THL573XC8bB8KHt-vkPlkoL5SNIuJTkTvQZag0P4F> , allowing it to A/B test different iterations of its mobile app. A blog post goes into detail about how exactly this all works, but as TechCrunch <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00107VHVOMNy6z3T0a2u8LPKe32zkYu4MhBJ7W-ScLMsQlX6MzhJMe5lHjEBWyFF5OUewp_blUmaugQPkmM66kATL8BDFerzPokvzZzHqLvNj8FuitIKk4agbZngjQWk3jrI5h8DiVvbqCc7O7yb-WL57A9fibskbEkWFO6eFuYJ0Q=>  points out it will improve user experience.


Preferable Paywall


On the Nieman Journalism Lab blog, Ken Doctor compares and contrasts newspaper giants The New York Times and The Wall Street Journal ability to overcome adversity brought on by Digital. He notes, "Advertising still represents a majority of revenues for the Journal, sources say, in the mid-50s percentagewise, with circulation in the mid-40s. That's the inverse of the Times, which recently reported that 56 percent of its revenues now come from readers. Given that reader revenue is now growing as paywalls have gone up, and that print ads remain in sharp decline, majority reader revenue seems to be the preferable market position." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00107VHVOMNy6wzuoTs38eltrJZJp_a10JImamnNeffXg_hObHNiFQc1l1ZEKqVI1rsiWIiU0_mX9_5FQz0Fb-qpEeI4WXxa70hTtRGyrLnjfjJG_EBSQHhdRJeV1Vb_7MDkvru0JBeXtV1Uz3JtTDosJKLA63IDPrkeevC8NLNQ3Kvjsu01wGcwLA__LpLWzi3b245-b0-aiw=> .


Consumer Marketing


More CMOs are focusing on the consumer, according to Andrew Frank, research VP at Gartner. Citing a study conducted by The Economist, the percentage of CMOs whose companies focused on customer intimacy increased from 21% to 37%. Consumers are becoming more aware of privacy issues online, which could cause them to guard their data a little more in the future. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00107VHVOMNy6xEujgC-4cdllomE9SsRidCvJDu49uCa6ZSXKoPgnEdImB6bAj-XolrVJvHMKqzpjSrdvfgjEINgmL7G7vxxubsTUgwweWi8UllVFltAcsXfioXOWIqDXXdKzvgVTZDTqz5xUPHm_WyvzDeJw-fvM0eRhhFLPpfp7lJkgj8sjGmizoMxmd-WdBhJpZ7-jKiPC32Plk3RCXW0A==> .


Ad Tech Crystal Ball


Mike Kisseberth, CEO at TechMedia Network, is predicting changes to both native and programmatic advertising, including the possible intersection of the two. In a post on folio, Kisseberth points out that a huge pain point for native right now is scale, but as that changes the ads will get more data-driven and regulated. For programmatic, media buyers will become more tech-savvy, and premium and direct will be more prevelant. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00107VHVOMNy6yXLhEer9hqYYqOHPVadjHGD74kinTYYhXZu8S2FjwBKZ9y7yDyAUx_Jn42X5DmPHnF032Xq4sOXwHE0psC-VnBGHHHnOpdit1VNIlYwM3J-jkyJjBd7tFBTfxs3mtB1sGf_u9O3IUHdwR8UUvAcVzKl6HQFvXXJzKy_-pDlqqjaQtaFoJt9acxZNpmriFmDhmE9l7dcm4WA0qwLOm4hZSf> .


Supergraphic Monday


Have you ever wondered what all of investment bank LUMA Partners' infographics <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00107VHVOMNy6z_8R2qM7H5NoxMOBhQLYARFVLbNkhK22q9eCIJ2j3JT04UV42a2bQnjyzujDryQrGE7eF8m3FeZdXhv4ciLRAhWRHvq79w4yl65y2ea_xhrh_7Em7vxYGc3qCz1BxpmbxkNqs5mRf0KZjJUpg2-ZdqnuNOzxMiSCk=>  on technology players and their ecosystems would look like if they were fused together into one graphic? Sure you have! Chief Marketer's Scott Brinker doesn't call out <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00107VHVOMNy6yrLwSDRviOCex6P5PxTI8K6Z0mtg_YIOezomutJKMqvHxAZVm85y3CMXzSNrYElZ9qKsYGx3SvoKSmB2yOiYhxDmIDnvsaCCgBZjiz0QSpBvsIs_H_uITZZXa7Bjssnk-azssC9DOdho_i7ygZ_F2JewPwwp8PSSm4rubmWWuVZcdAfG-IZ2-EJ8udD8z3emg=>  LUMA by name, but does create what he calls a "Supergraphic" for marketing technology. See it now (PNG) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00107VHVOMNy6woE74mT1HfpGyzUtAdml6oUgEcvfUNVXHLJrIE3jniUfe7zDtNKkqE9wriAroySRKQKXKJPzDWej_833kR6rgnlBy5foUiE3o5w4HJB6onaDLgWvN4YYp0-TH8gCv1IqTngYTfplVZCIJocl5-lg8yUl4d3Dl2CiWUnY4sxmimMAXhtOz3iRBjn4uP9maLz1gYWRHZX3zQBw==> .

Tracking Facebook


A Facebook PMD, ShopIgniter is looking to bridge the social site with the mobile Web, according to Inside Facebook. The company uses a Web landing page with a URL tag to track conversions, which is then used to create a Facebook ad. Right now many Web landing pages are not optimized for that level of analytics. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001zEUJHc7MLOzvpIk-wQTpEoEgAPxj7QbXh_FQX5Fzy1z3SlDAe-gtqDgxIMYvIvKHRKZKxfM2iTyDKjeaZ28XCBeKVBv8_sHl1nEBE4_4Qfxh43gpC14nI5gn9UR_wClKlW5EuIEdtf1XA6pg49_angavzvIGOrjbOoG5OCqVzsxi1IUNcmha-prvwlwKSch4Eg5RwcKyntfIiCtjTRG7EEJYUnDWEnRdFJLbvQG6xh8=> .


The New, New Internet


The Internet is endless, but Web pages aren't, though that will likely change, as Digiday points out. Sites like Quartz, and even some Yahoo properties, have broken ground in providing an endless stream of content that mirrors users' habits with social media. The only hangup is figuring out advertising on the new Web, as advertisers are used to metrics such as clicks and impressions instead of engagement. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001zEUJHc7MLOyyzoC6_bBTwpy24OV5lW0g1gbiWgRkx2Gc_mJjhczGz4kIbbfjIlsgo-QV1Sxcxz96sChymh6FlFlyoSTLGhXeAI-j1j5zxj2BkFz-D_4rn0dBDaWamHJN8K_gDve5SQepgOCK_5k67g==> .


Open TV


Simulmedia is offering two new tools, Plan and Report, to offer advertisers a glimpse into targeted TV advertising. Plan gives estimates on the size of a TV audience and Report is a campaign-measurement tool. "We are always hearing interest in benchmarks," Dave Morgan, chief executive officer of Simulmedia, told MediaPost at the time. "It's not guesswork any more." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001zEUJHc7MLOycy0FInlXpPCAtKbnjEHUXuVu7m9C818FEZMvc9BhFIIjNRmzfXTyrsh9QL_UX15tX3g6sbOHg21UzA1Fx5DB18exeOMuzmMFR8jl_NVNEeY5SQrgL1-LiWSrPggv6EaaffHHoh8XwwxKjbflVJUlIdGWhs0E4d3CssURbJv1awbrp3GXxVybb9F0av1lCkccuPmMKXY8jFeQ5qkcU9OaX> .


Closer To POG


EU regulators have joined the US in greenlighting the merger of Publicis Groupe and Omnicom Group, which will create the world's largest ad services company. A few hurdles remain (China approval, stock exchange listings, shareholder vote), but the deal is expected to close later in Q1. Press release. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001zEUJHc7MLOyqr3_tAe2vXBWVdato8LHoybo6S1mp29Ajv368sHQYYcSEmFJjmL-3sIeHDZPthtMqqRhCD1Qq_g0GHvcORH1UerWLx-To6KTQmMAlKGuR26Tq37HyRhWEBeRlFqRiJpcA-qHXyfgkgbWIJ9VLSVF9_vyhzsUJilTg-iMjLSEpzR8N_AnRLkKLddUbOLyE1CiD6V9Hty2qbWFWkuXc-wti> 


The New CMO


Today's CMO is starting to look a little different, as pointed out by Bowery Capital, and the shift is to younger, Internet native marketers. Other changes include the hiring of writers and front-end developers as a priority, and the new CMO is more capable of handling data collection and analysis. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001zEUJHc7MLOyFDQXfi4veUk37nTDJo7TFKygjzI2W_58LVHGGKpcp-ALdEo8HH24v2tMjYHI7nAahbtiMbazzGlk2iROok9-6NZoU_4zNM5Rf50Uk6afV7CDTrgJq3l-bdXRLQYuIEfzhAxwrBmAXGisA759J-gsBfFRLn17D8Um4wqUR9I1Qur-7VCXmNxLLrIU0YlXyoMU=> .


BI Spawn


Three former Fab.com employees have ventured out on their own to create a new startup, called Wunderdata, and the comapny has received seed funding from WestTech Ventures. According to VentureBeat, the startup offers business intelligence tools to online stores. The founders were not part of the recent layoffs that have occurred at Fab. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001zEUJHc7MLOzZmFdGFhQkfGh8D59s5XNjQGVQMp-R0Xs2ZybdCDMsYZvzbVWztWUpSXqcHYhOsr6_wW83vc4cerbiopEYxnG-JAyA2-WcNC_00qqd8avo1zhpZdsBuBD3scdbu9niBb5xwf6DmQ6le34p6EC3iOcV7Pwt3LlQ89iP88cOz-oDyGAmlbRuVhOUOMJNrk5Q5dPfwpjL_nomJ835DPOj3yD4> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MKyCon0SWYPp71PE488wyE_NV4paxyl6H8M3HfovWlszYKe1a-vKqM-gEx2BXWZTLQtRhHTsRV-Y9pRFhtEBlG05-oaEarI3vxM0myYiRSXy2_X4R9ub8t1YUYCnIN50qj4WJC1Ojao=> .

 

Social Bots Link-In

 

Bots don't just haunt display advertising, they're creating problems for social sites too, forcing LinkedIn to take legal action, according to GigaOM. The company's competitors use the bots to scrape information from user profiles, but there it's not clear what risk this behavior might be to users. "We're a members-first organization and we feel we have a responsibility to protect the control that our members have over the information they put on LinkedIn," the company said in an email. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MKyCon0SWYNHDfdvmidDul3LpdJ7oQq23wa8bRmxBdnGWx1192vQX7Rnmz25Uaopnvva_qOLJBcYA-WE3pVLMOCE9oSZP89mpL8mGFeSRDjYzCpTrTVXLREjFlgp7QjpKXGCmqdRMPQzhbH0rSGIlDb3GofJ1j_KsDflMR6Q8f8bRS353vZGveVR8Xn1PWP0DFqW-wylqbcvYxulEwOgNj1Apy-7JsJs> .

 

The Data Year

 

The 2014 predictions continue rolling in, and James Moore, CRO of Simpli.fi, foresees 2014 being the year data increases in value to marketers. His arguments center around the increasing RTB inventory, cross-device targeting capabilities and the move toward unstructured data. In his opinion, programmatic is going to allow marketers and advertisers to unlock the full potential of their audience data. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MKyCon0SWYMNuBaOErFgNV54KoXJoKYYtKb33y4IqYc6xSvTm7QUfrIuHwA0u6d_NDIggGdy40nlRhfSOZ6ur9UiH-RpbSqcZpDsw3syd_e6kX3ekAY_ddP9dKQ0knIwlSpcbJBhc70UaO9Y-N3M4zElJEf6pRERM-yiOVfrGG9VvenpFADdTQ==> .

 

The P Word

 

The advertising industry is full of jargon and acronyms, but one that especially bothers Doug Weaver, founder and CEO of Upstream Group, is "partner." In a post on his blog he points out that it seems the industry is self conscious about using terms like "seller," "vendor" and "supplier" to describe relationships, and would rather use a blanket term like "partner." Read the post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MKyCon0SWYMiLrzmEC0eglJm9-xnphv61x8k_CXY1Kdz7ETU5XgNI8rtisuWA5igKjrY3YKA_-gearFMo-BaJd08d97FS_Dnnrvkzebuabz8nWBMOfnam-pVlGkzB4zsDMoJoYHWpMRzTjzeUqvCMQ==> . Another P word, blanket term, favorite: "platform."

 

Ad Rules

 

The Weather Channel broke some rules and put an auto-play longer than 10 seconds on Twitter through Amplify, according to Adweek. Twitter hasn't yet commented about whether it will pull the ad. Facebook has been experimenting with autoplay ads in user's news feeds that are 15 seconds long. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MKyCon0SWYMj-aBhJOjmfmKi5o-YRdfSee9_suOzPRgB7jV2pr1A7GpH9yvxUaCchPsQYdg_q2dUZLHH8Cm1dyFd_dgsjvLeTK0Lwv8CsSdcKdw0MkXlBCK_rJ6btqOJNowqHWLShKL6_u08wY-rfe6GJNNcs0mR-2Ms7GozKeF6Wiz19Ek20DVCiE-WiFe_bmYn9gAgbq5DLYRFGJANuNY_N8gavwai> .

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00119ZSxkmO7cYBylCbTL3LXCGrGft92UJDiQ8oGdpRs9Jy10MqSdi2_1xi13XyTcPwRPjffMDqHN7-o0Ewb3da7xah8VXUMTWJ8VOpklHwGWgfvZYzxcmgkm-CjL00CyjhA6TxA0c337g=> .

 

Small-Town Tweeting

 

Not to be outdone by other social networks, Twitter is strengthening its local advertising ability with a new feature called Nearby, Digiday reports. The map feature shows users what others are tweeting about in their vicinity. This could open up a host of advertising options from local businesses and even national chains with a local presence, such as Macy's or Starbucks. "Nearby sends a stronger signal versus Foursquare," said Dirk Rients, director of mobile at DDB. "With a tweet, there's more context. It's more than just location; you can tie location to the mood of the user." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00119ZSxkmO7cZLetiofwi4TSbKRoJstpX0WfpmvnxroqFFFjUw7WFscGehcAV1hW27lyZTnXNZML5QxXP7rLYVmoHkGYDAsRl3T7UQkByYirCt7yMCFJ34ziGpJXyx7BBY1YClgIUddKKKHACpCPr7yJQBVxfZwHflOGl8sz_d6fwf4-vYRFUogKjWrjkH2dif> .

 

Buying Customer Service

 

Microsoft has acquired customer service SaaS Parature for $100 million, which will add to its CRM platform. According to TechCrunch, the new acquisition will allow Microsoft to communicate with customers through multiple channels at the same scale as a complex call center. One area that is still lacking is commerce, according to Ray Wang, founder of Constellation Research. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00119ZSxkmO7cb-5VE5w3a19hg3UypZ7ESbwgOfPEdmuP3653ZDLAsuPJGSbCQc7ILaPxtsK4EZzom2VtmRkiLgIv2YHvEjmNmNNoE41EchduJmb_yVNpBVhQ8u0O3dp8DZ8JJdSwnQB4LNiojayubkWPBb_RT-rAFhVLSRFRaM8j-TMkphbMx_otPpPlE0bY_rDa_h-jI7wFhqX0mvSGKjkSa9Dy2PhvdzERbA2EXbKwTv-vxi5-OIxw5sXbDZkaNEyeVMxPwDx3DlMFe_EyhV4A==> . And read about it in Destination CRM <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00119ZSxkmO7cbgB5QcBW6iDWUisRZkJlvkGeMyaZ3ZkHTfImvFmzuuDilL3Md6RVgTjzdyQVSw1TgrtqOKNMvLTabszRzMeUPQnCf_nfMdsLUNX_3wiMsvP8nq4pGedL_DYienzg7O0xkGFt9kth3uTCA-cQvmIZpCQ4qVPlssu6Y3gyTMOZyxiOgE2koxebzP> .

 

Nontraditional Display

 

In PandoDaily, Infolinks CEO (and former Blue Lithium and Yahoo exec) Dave Zinman weaves a story about his company's tech and its "take" on the display ad. Zinman uses a consumer survey his company undertook, and Pando's Cale Guthrie Weissman writes, "In short, the survey found that non-traditionally placed ads - those that aren't in the usual 'ad banner' spaces of above or to the side of websites - performed much better than traditional ones. Further, it found that people just didn't like traditional ads." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00119ZSxkmO7cYuPszfjlF1bDtSz2LnUU9AOXBY3xDb7ts7_kpCbcMhFvzTXpiToh_Mc46uxM8MO34q9BPM-WIqAS8OH3el4z8fxG8BiF9wvzK0zLCcqQrs-FXyZCmJqE72iZqj3KGvN_KMzjQTnjzr4zDcPoMtbJFt-kcIbDEkPTo=> . Read Zinman's 2012 interview about "banner blindness" with AdExchanger here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00119ZSxkmO7cZ-6SvpaCGOlUgWhUgA78ExynWzQuLPVUN15QqJiETm_oTU44fc3Gb-4eORuCLxq37C1cuyL4cGlOhhVLRsgQG2oSxOYpxIxyOL7SYIeOwzljAHn0EaAzZkQyAXzJ7csZFzFEBBbijIZaobIOEjsEKAantydMVV92rU1qqij5YxW49ptqKfDpSi> .

 

Local Motion

 

Yodle is taking marketing automation to the local level with its new Centermark product, according to Screenwerk. "The platform provides a source of shared data, communication and reporting that facilitates informed conversations between all the partners on the network," the company told Greg Sterling. The service is also billed as a SaaS licensing model rather than being based on performance. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00119ZSxkmO7cbLoLgkmmPrDr_Mb62TQY9mjUEF8TuHzKwqdDF7OihwYDbP64IsJ4zR3VTnoATV5XlwvVVbbzlVBcF3KVjHeUn1-U92x1w6ToCBxSSK2-N5db2hb48W8cZpbkvurwqLVab-aP9xZ8KfA8LmLNB1LfNnjFECwum5sI9-orPFsoyc0JqKzwv5_p4l5cmXVccfhq4FTZ1PVcXw26lF-FgYaULteeNg4OTiSPs=> 

 

The Loyalty Factor

 

Nielsen is going beyond basic TV ratings by tracking loyalty to networks as well, according to Ad Age. The first study it conducted included 75 cable entertainment networks and the results showed that USA Network came in first place, with Bravo close behind. However, TBS ranked fifth out of 75, despite the fact that it is poised to have the No. 1 ratings slot. "This is not a replacement for ratings, but a compliment [sic] to better assess the quality of the environment," said David Kaplan, VP for research at Bravo. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=00119ZSxkmO7cZyU3Fc4EVUXztmN7WRilf6Rbj6BFR2gdLgFr8n55GBSbxnyA5xlF93WcpoVX0MVAz6_Y8wNCa8--UfAT6OqrIhSV8RfqG2m9UBawP1ySyWACp8HA4tu6QylpKdIMEYgQ3YmAvCPCc6zuiDpUtSsnKmo-yXr8DiSdPNfD8qJhrRLoBWn0IrR6KMmr2vBuPSq6SVnb9BD7zgXQ==> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0019qf7DcYHD1PdQc7RS4WzTOKNYd3-3KHgO262gPhU3Vmra55QZg0_5GFlXyQ_G9uboyL2hd58MjMcucundx1Bv9ys8m6XGhs7cODbO_LcC0UPp0tE1AyP4hepc4i_jIeJZXrmAaHsUK0=> .

 

When Malware Strikes

 

Malware was delivered to consumers via a display ad in several European countries, according to multiple reports. NBC aggregates the news and says that, according to one source, "9 percent of visitors to the malicious site through a Yahoo! ad were infected by the malware, which is about 27,000 infections per hour. The first sign of infection dates back to Dec. 30." Romania, Great Britain and France were apparently most affected. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0019qf7DcYHD1Nhapu03j4UHEPNAzGTsD5W52phiYDlyvQ3c60vjx431D8yxZokF750dC_PMoSWpYxNCfo5TrFwOS9ZfMQTfC_pG40nFxufWiPctGZDkTDiWsp5wQFTCotoTvIzoOt8lepKs7E216NFxCtwmomKWKpiaApezLXl3z4t1OO2XXlmyIjYzEchn1WbeMlrmYYQhEQ=> 

 

The New Radio

 

Pandora launched its first in-car ads, according to Adweek, and has signed deals with BP, Ford, State Farm and Taco Bell. Pandora has been aggressive about getting its streaming radio service into cars and is now available in nine of the top 10 selling cars. "We are now seizing the opportunity to connect advertisers with a more targeted audience than traditional radio can provide," said Pandora's chief marketing officer, Simon Fleming-Wood. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0019qf7DcYHD1OzGHroHCflybfcMG2bZIPC-PYB2vsgJmrWcVU4p-Z9dy4vqHM_9Q5lcRWVJr4Y-8WlakaeYcid-wnOs3x_3Jyx-BiqfC-i3NI3g2X_gVFYhM3bt_FJHwhiFA4PPi0UMRdXY5aETyuItXfRYxDc0hrijrUzwQqrBYOkDoiM_bmyg_18cv-7hmsg> .

 

When Facebook Went 'Nonsocial'

 

Buried in a Sunday WSJ story on Mark Zuckerberg's evolution as a media executive is a description of his eventual embrace of "nonsocial ads" such as retargeting placements and CRM matching. "At the time, it kind of struck me as a crazy idea," Zuckerberg said, because it seemed to depart from his early vision of enabling word-of-mouth marketing at scale. The rest is history. More <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0019qf7DcYHD1PsMwpwifVsmD5f5fyet5IB0KtxzgDqCPkd6WGuaAqZxFBIkjuXzZAp4M_beNbj_c5_r5kD8TKflGp567BkLU3o69PWNXhz8kO0HsbgqrBBKbcr4xa-j1pZ6OG-p6Wuno4FYUx9Lbm53sZn70U_Ve0KKl_en4pKvC2q9mnCnp9_r4SWqgr369E1hjtsEy6LhwRK0fQibSjgmmaLba7u0aydiMbIMmycjAlVrq5PTnIOTg==> .

 

Pin Detection

 

Pinterest has picked up visual search and image-recognition startup VisualGraph in a move that further points to future moves in ad monetization, Josh Constine of TechCrunch reports. As AdExchanger <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0019qf7DcYHD1Namhn8gi5RSM6YXvbkz5ibkUXW2j7D0QAaYNO4ba3OaQQkMZ0P_wFAQtvtmI8EFoNt9_iQYtlRVuLva1zLo4C2OgRFv-_tM0PEMgFqvOWwItSbJlthrx4_wi1wg9OxyvFPrJXFM5y4m5Lb0HW6J5_8fo93QhCzaUXdaowSeHaHNVzarYwnU7kHSY8LulXxxyGnY4MglmnGSc-_Xp3XNT97>  reported in November, Pinterest's partnership with Getty Images (which acquired an image-recognition platform of its own in 2011) gave it access to more verifiable product data. With the number of brands active on its platform, Pinterest looks to be building an imagecentric engine of intent-fueled recommendations. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0019qf7DcYHD1NmfvDLglf-aB_0p6ZCFsqmPFzZp0u_W1BXTBx2-m9TuK6tlsiKcPV8-xTw9vglY3ZFZCLSHijTbtO1Fk6aAahrI1uqS_542LXxf7oVaIG2nWouGtpl-nFNyPZF5OR91tq0v58JU0EFZwEcyXfL2_tAPsQ8oXbsa74=> .

 

CNN Shakeup

 

CNN President Jeff Zucker and his platform-agnostic view may usher CNN into the digital age, a feature in Ad Age points out. One change Zucker intends to make in 2014 is to tailor videos for the Web and mobile instead of repurposing TV airings. Advertisers still need convincing, though, as some have pulled their ads from the network, citing better CPM rates from Fox and MSNBC. "We never want to give up on breaking news. But the types of programs we do offer will be broader -- informational, educational, entertaining. You will see more of that next year, allowing us to broaden the audience and field to advertisers," Zucker said. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0019qf7DcYHD1PETV8uajUzddeq0fucAOIU4IfG-PqmDs0hXzALslIDpv1WMEU3RiDf68jJ7E3rhtHvIt8EJ6RTFhgvcr57OOvceWPedmTvOgjeGNQy1aVSNyp1OqrfAiY6kn_3QEZSAeCsWmhFdC4vOa4IK_uCDkKshIGujyyl0XG2ZpDfc1L5NZ4EDlNz3SdbGSQgzEhkoeg=> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001famjHNNzdeh7VPfkV0pKqbZTI8eQZRjtx766vwXiyVU0BiDC5gprAuAubWyX4Pgv1i1EONpiYXQnBzXrzOz1v47a-poFIhYuj0nbxC78ta5WNSqbTmyo8pIo3dvIWdMR7kTaNIfLFKE=> .

 

Intel's TV Dreams Doused

 

Intel's CEO Brian Krzanich says in an interview with Re/code's Ina Fried that Intel gave up on its Internet TV service because the technology was there, but the content wasn't. "You could have the biggest screen, you could have the clearest screen. But if there is not great content on this thing, that big-screen TV is not a huge value to you, even though it has the best picture on the planet," Krzanich said. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001famjHNNzdejhyyqOuQgTEeDqF7wRtxmHlvdaDKgRjYdf3FHuJaQkMZ56I146PADDiDC6igAnaudMpeN8E5agIf3GpGvWeMlO10ZCG_KVkXJ_9UYbgk77VQ-PmMpgAZUG55YKLRZaUg-QeIanrRJoa-N-1U1TVRDiIKuzhrdQRpgmMY3dtK4I6MI9Z5VNVL7dBoQU190MBOX1DxxJnr_Z1Tz87YkaLdN8qkXSBIEh7pM=> . And that's why Google's YouTube initiatives around content make sense, for instance.

 

Native Times

 

The New York Times is planning a redesign that will launch Wednesday to make way for its new native ad content, according to Adweek. The ads will only appear on the desktop site for now, and will be labeled as "Paid Posts" and have a blue border to differentiate them. There has been some contention over native advertising, especially the the confusion it could create for readers. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001famjHNNzdehVkFZ6G8lUfPne6xinw6P8M8MpgJyvAS0RcjdNw4sf73l_KYwMHKRZE5-P9NVK8jN_6Ed4Te36FWWN-PxuYXSLKhbIJX7c9XTzgCtjoJS8XUhJWyK2OK9Dcpzr4Z_oNHSC9obfNRgaBaAPoIQirI01jixA2N0CWwjfVIHCooYuwQdaN3uLJEk1Cv1wqc9AIXw=> .

 

The Data War

 

When it comes to data, first-party is the best, but there is no shortage of companies willing to sell third-party data for a high price. Paul Rostkowski criticizes the practice on Ad Age, given that so little of the third-party data may actually be useful. If marketers aren't diligent about testing the data they could end up wasting a lot of money. Not to mention first-party data is free along with other basic information such as geography and URL domains. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001famjHNNzdeiQXeUgoFgQEc65GIYwS4n-C1h3ckJz4SegAUzZzHIN2DGxGRRL5-BkwQjSZKeaIICCgJn22JwInxeatqkLU6Yogmzi2arLDGusZjlPCUF-1gGq0kMe9RzBDZsGUQCcqvGXcprn-wtlVCxRjJ_lCdnoGXpS2rGfZNIgtkk3epDsIf6ukwGNikqZrnL1zQSQWJE=> .

 

Tech Merger Billions

 

The world of mergers and acquisitions continues to pulse as some of the larger tech players add solutions and products to their marketing tech portfolio. With Oracle's acquisition of Responsys, Marketo is rumored to be next among "the acquired." IBM and SAP are considered among the potential "strategics." Read more in Bloomberg <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001famjHNNzdehmmORLS72FVINaTY95QC6bnf1CqZYcSSAzeAoLrw0T0YJyP7Pe9KuWeyL4_uIyp13nTS42NMIu6gOm7fHVbLTQTeDD6pHG6ppS7BWh-Bft4OQ3kceS32g1xsKMQ1cRFh1CJ98Nk_-g8-eNep148MaIpSI-Pew7KT4DLZJ90mMY5Z0SE7xvAjUQmR_yOOrN7cEs5Sr-G4Zwhusck2KOMhPEm6cOukGRVyMJ5lGh5yGSnQ==> . The stock market values Market at $1.6 billion <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001famjHNNzdegq8cpuZ-iK0fdZAoenLJ0wHMxx3tSoAsOdhA16cKmEZSjgXKj-iCXR6lQZvvtX-N80BkrqnCWwYt0uY7LQAoDdwkpsWFdsdX2xBKGuDEv1V7rxINmYxlNaKMmWGHaNHagAFjxArq-E8tmlRs2Uu0z7> + on Friday with its "marketing tech" story. For comparison, ad network 2.0 Rocket Fuel and ecommerce retargeter Criteo were valued around $1.95 billion <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001famjHNNzdeiGVrUtYswo8xhs-6GB-wHOU2peqpTVL01iOi_M9tCgBHj5U0hisr2QVViVwadhWcvWKmh4QhqfLZOtadywZWmQ9N1P1grAovrw9SQICZtd5kXEgVLQVCPKdWlXIY3OlrF_slgByFeLAXv-u_5Jcx-t>  and $1.8 billion <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001famjHNNzdehjUUeTo8L9x3NQkdIA9crIDpNiAL1uZ2NPrwmeeNanQyxt03SwZOJRz3e4nrczZIvM_UdPw-_dpcTp2jKuPs8BqgpMaIALSSg9KJalaL5BXGWUGbv0p6YOjVJzZRD2h5db-eGIb9ThCzSILCwjvB2d> , respectively, as of Friday's market close with their "ad-tech" stories. Increasingly, marketing and ad-tech stories are merging.

 

The Rise Of Mobile

 

LinkedIn Marketing Solutions aggregates mobile ad spend data in an article on Mashable. Mobile ad spend nearly tripled from 2012 to 2013, going from $1.2 billion to $3 billion. And, social is driving a lot of spend - in particular, native advertising, which could reach $4.3 billion in 2014, according to the article. An eMarketer graphic predicts that mobile and online ad spending will increase year-over-year, reaching $61.4 billion overall by 2017. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001famjHNNzdeg9ikTA0vbxmdZm_bpzCn7P_gWQ5YPDjw_AjSZzWU1MU2Oyn6cwTExDdMOCC7EUlwOirEXV1XqykwbtRtQGbOUonvg4gZzvVtIvEfeDRCesiZvuCj735hthCKxOBNmxY9w8-DiIcRwOEfknjWhEFgssGEF69ex239U=> .


The News Of Weather

 

The Weather Channel is no longer just a utility, it's a media company, under the financial auspices of NBCUniversal, Blackstone and Bain Capital. As the New Republic points out, the company not only increased the amount of original journalism on the site, it has also begun naming winter storms, giving it a social media edge. "We are absolutely all about information dissemination during severe weather," said a spokesperson, "but we also have tons of amazing content for when the weather is 70 and sunny." And that means more clicks. Read about it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001famjHNNzdeh5uQ_RrpcTcbGWt5BjK2r-zNpVZmpqWwQUCWdmy8lW-d9Pah-fMpurzFzWigNOKlU7-uBs19vy6QOSqYA4BKJczcA8niaww2ShD3vrVX2TXhBw8Ndha6zVyK4RaT_r5_Kri2jAiuPKZJOVYCwbipktqc0a3pqOi_pVImyfFbsRZWxeOy0TEPCjr73mYF8UZOHid7fbOAsSRA==> .

Funding The Valuer

 

PandoDaily made note <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4nbhmF6Ov9oZ4y5iP5jrt8f3fCMlqYmLSylKRUMbk7XeqRdLtwamNzHG3xzWqByWGZM_dTtf5s-i3KAzBF51Dmg_xnS7AOlbhHvImDAXAp8KlbeeVBIPmo7AtpndtmnMC0SwSw8H4t7YLhOl7DkmRZTO-KcSFxhAS18BG2M266RDrKgwdDx9AyaZbA4qqL00LUIGxGTjNDYbQ==>  yesterday of a new $30 million round of funding by digital media valuation company Integral Ad Science. See the SEC filing <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4kajjmnxVj0cumCzPp7MshUZ35GdDf70a3lrLk0yHYA4FQphuGqIZhHQJ_lJPcuO6Xu-WyKZIZNUDRxDNWJ2XL6CuhNFzQZqKCucP0GwUXn4TpyjMobx1q33NvbYuX9ES4LioeJmv6UXU0iLonDjHgP0lHmehdvn2n4X4LSieBFWFWrowhTq8DgjP8YJ_7ahWKZWjEUYKf6ej0nc_eJOH5S> . Pando's Erin Griffith references the comScore patent battle <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4kFttosaTutNTDr7aU4N1mMx2bcTBuQRBB5IX3mTXOJ4gwEDd6sa-64HBQPxa82YgsLTEYiQ9_uIrpx1xaz02Tb9htvqLMmeuNqZ-7xxqfSeR4neMLC0I7-CWyi4g04LMbrozk7OzQ2c8BNQT_ijZnAH2TDBYvSC9hh6-b5cn2jyQ==>  that Integral Ads has moved beyond: "After its patent battle, Integral Ad Science beefed up on its own patents <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4kj5Eg0j4Yh9Xh14lQrM-4b4mdZqbiMybzz-AO2ItsYUAE1SoNDsekV2Peot9Z_MTNsxunIcu6Q59l2O81i9gVjI7q0c6NuMQUg5NBMuY0Ix24jHl9tbKHHl6IN61u1Kva_8gI848cuBqDvGrT_cpt1MIAZFFnwVAnd1DNSVDDH4Z7otGLNCnjKMogqXKfICNnKLvRd-cP9cAc2AX6HV9i2gbWA-ByKqls=> . The company last month acquired a patent for ad blocking, which sounds counterintuitive for an ad-tech company. But the firewall tool under the patent is for making sure that brands don't end up buying ads next to content they don't want to be seen near." Related: Integral Ads was talking "bots" in November - read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4kIZA6xnj93fblhO7N1dkeSkVNluATx94ZSNQ7ABx9HzAvlsZwTL07Retk1HaJjDP7GKVu4OQneAjth1DoKn9qvbWyXXQ73FbKvaOlDsnG2bNjnOinawOkuS74yMi3fpRZKLg7E0SwKApx_uZ-734htFAIdLSY04yFbN_Lrr1_rcvEXkFPC8RrEGp34-USsjChS-H4nzGtf2BF6AHxVTDh2kagHLOcpLFODrRGIvyM0Rc0CAFN_L5xP7zIuGtucIMM=> .

 

Publication Reboot

 

AllThingsD is no more, but two of the minds behind it, Kara Swisher and Walt Mossberg, have launched a new publication called Re/code. The site falls under the Revere Digital company, with NBCUniversal News Group and Windsor Media as investors and partners. The company will continue to produce events as well as operating news sites and apps. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4koFur4SePCD7oxr4dyWLnEx2kuGlKALEBSJl8DyfG6ivjE4rs8mzvPUcfJhL6lhru-eJBk0KcbdRB07Cb3B444mgIjDxZox0w6OaTWLy8p_U3_Qdea8-T50EzaV8hqyoU5653gHNBGFm6piByoiWNE> . And read the NYT's take <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4kEY5f82wGJl8DdvrB6LBUUiLhmbw_wTDSzKtgz0bldPEhLaZt2l6VhQQRuJE388jlGhl07cnITCTGasGnB8_v6InEkRbbH4hwHMvcrE6-wqmzv7yWmgMNBAJrhVbRC8hbag7xAFeOY8XC-vmNqVIYlkKXooycjpsJ6IC9v3JfnKmZLCtfo0mJERU9OJdcMx0eHWnTGebH6YEdyA9_MR3zh>  on Re/code. Meanwhile, AllThingsD's owner, The Wall Street Journal, has launched WSJD in its place. Read about it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4lbhGUMJuYvbDafNO0VSfxXmtnBlWF56ys-3gXgAawCzmzNkVWrRDk18Cp2d4O8Gh1l_jShju4Kzd2xoaeejJ49CCS4HK2hOyhvhg5TbFqJKGHpV-BR8IAmDCs8_M3Eevhf7iHlK4646_3xegIq7omtuQ-vYSG9Nlq53S6oKYfLKK7cSpa2FgqlgEa_jvokQYY=> .

 

Shifting Consumption

 

Millennial men are flocking to the Internet for news consumption and leaving magazine publications such as GQ and Maxim behind. This wave of bro media, as Digiday referred to it, is attracting large advertiser dollars despite risks to brand safety. "You don't sell skinny jeans in Disneyland," said Solly Solomou, founder of UK-based TheLadBible.com. "You have to be naive to say brands aren't going to connect themselves with this type of content if that's where their audience is." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4n0ym8eCbftexHm6NHYHLH1I82eqSJ6XzR0m4GwccDmexCnAooDBHCUnXyK2vpimQtdLOSE4gAusOzL1vZih8qq6DCNyXEnLdCM2ZjTr-Xbsqmh59MWE8RS_D3YFswyH_tqTtn6Qg-BmyuFAg6LWcF_QnKLLib3N_o=> .

 

Digitizing CRM

 

India-based digital CRM company Vizury dipped into the venture well with a $20 million raise. Vizury CEO Chetan Kulkarni tells TechCrunch, "We'll invest in building local products for markets like China, because that's the only way it can become a billion-dollar market." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4kuXM-wTO5v7wKCWieBfBcDYN3nQuIH2tTUuFrn772o70ysshH0n5DIBYaZMhsoykrXTVJN2GLZg-Dmk8ckUEE9FUjMsrT_adtu69fITiG55tYUdrsyNVtrPgj7eVCWqsD3Q3UaLfvMUE6H2L64xFrMXU8s8v18cXPA_pthNgAsdxk00NXAsr3S1Xl6nu6H-qdSuh7bizYy1uX2zauMPYEd> . Kulkarni spoke to AdExchanger in November. Read that one <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4kb0oBYrt8U2jgmGhJNvXsLLzNS49-pRnJQ30KWMDHUZhT6AXe3DBzIvGupYnoVcdwIExzHyq-tLH4rbT1Pele9-Hp9bPc8m36k_p6sXdd9H6mnqU1APZ9frR54o-aMdS38Nvpbk1Hu8Q==> .

 

Preempting Privacy

 

If marketers aren't proactive about data collection and privacy, it could end up costing them in the end, according to Ad Age. Although consumers ask for more relevant ads, argues Jonathan Salem Baskin, it doesn't mean they are willing to give away all of their personal information for free. As organizations like the Federal Trade Commission start making the issue more public, consumers will likely become more diligent about the data they share. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4mXZgwKtinVo852bw5XmZs9m81ieUpKavIZVJyONmFv2zATVd1l6e5_RxdKWYXr59gokZM5tnpEHKqCn_B0hLQujESUHFXCfLC_K-UPMfjGEXxdx1jQtugYkn_7Kkv6nRvsF1iPZJV6Pg2r5WWCzbJ3tNLClLs2LQ14Tznd_sYgxARKRX_rmDSWtT-vLudcC_HgsAHocmYGAAsZQKQeoGD6EU1pa8_EN0A=> .


Demand Up, Expanding Out

 

Opera Mediaworks is expanding its presence in Latin America, according to Mobile Marketing Watch, as demand for ads in the region accelerates. The team behind Hunt Media Ads is joining Opera Mediaworks across multiple countries in the region. "Latin America, from Mexico to Argentina, represents a market of over 600 million consumers that are rapidly adopting the mobile Internet," says Mahi de Silva, CEO, Opera Mediaworks. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001-9y7k5osK4na4GfXP5m4HIyTUlusA6nNUccrv7UqeL-WAoz3CzDgPg62noJOGyczSDwWbFpJ_GK9JA-DH9h3csgg1ksSf5QYprxk0uqbkaRLhe3lGQZhzZFcHnW5oK7-6IthpE6Oj18wpDrCgwtyTxMnuvqNmT5BRKLL9PnmWAguRo7Z1vlDSRvpXL_XXcR3Rw2XDrwUnd6XPJIZnHKPcA==> .

*	Data-Driven Thinking column...A Call For Sharper Bidding by Andrew Casale, Casale Media <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001e0IymLCAx88HTuAymNbwvG8Ffjvq4McyAezpcSvoT_fyGBjPCBymmuMMYK7t9ntB8cgmls7J4Cu6vSmQpjPg35g8X9hdofBbLJsDnIxh_f27IA6ste7g57hTT_zGJkv1Wn75jLzdOEDzTVADEx5GaC-cQBXZbTvlMGad2TF3tBTbadoxb2z_uZOfywaMhK9H>  "Buyers should think more about optimizing to the second-highest bid, instead of their opening bid price, as this is effectively what becomes their clear price. If you force yourself to bid no more than $2 because that is the ceiling you are willing to pay, you'll limit yourself from a multitude of scenarios where a $3, $5 or $10 bid may still clear far below your $2 ceiling..." (visit AdExchanger)
*	The Complications Of Merging Marketing And Ad Tech <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001e0IymLCAx89-uYMzcAWbPUc4X4YZ4DHka5_93whX0vtalmDXyiXStrJWQGnjeJxoTFoeukaRtwFDo205mqV0-YtnozkJOi3B5t6MyVv41TwBewy9W3cGTRMt-p0BMIHqGeJepM51lJqDnW_85hzjfCoigMPi1Th-w1EVUkZVArVa_jIoQG1DCTPGCklANZnzDpQ0xUhyVllfTFCI1_lbn5ch81C4iFx_>  "When you talk about data management from an advertising perspective, it's typically more channel-specific ... We switch over to marketing data management, where the No. 1 source is CRM. This is all the historical data that pertains to sales interactions, venue interactions, Web behaviors..."  News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001e0IymLCAx89ng4Z3sgVIFDpaeycd-stvyUogMrsoZU_YfTJ78pW3khxFgFTKIE_EQv4SzIGzI-aC0Ldoj_ZV0j29Yfqtk7IrpuHxAEXY8e4rbGXly_0yp35lihg0AzkCh5_h6Mc3W1A=> .

 

Record Highs For Ad Revenue

 

While you/we were away, a report from the IAB and Pricewaterhouse Coopers revealed that Q3 Internet ad revenues hit a high of $10.69 billion. "These figures reflect marketers' trust in interactive to deliver," said Randall Rothenberg, president and CEO of IAB. "It is indicative of the digital age in which we live, and within which advertisers need to effectively reach targeted audiences wherever they are consuming information or entertainment - often on several screens at once." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001e0IymLCAx881UZocXOw1gR5gMIY5TuObYXBgNUV-djOnyzDVLM8UAwUa8u6KgyBbP1CAiNzqOemvos2CtKcLRL-eySbxjN3zSVPwYODX34u0ZtCli86mbIfr2N7wl-I4LuFfkgmnAw-bOGi815cBFxqJ4yg1NmhFH_xLzXhEj404lPzSt2a5JMmRP1KFEAoW5U8cvkrJzEUrK34mH7ycOKEz0GEe4ukD1WmxIMZati4=> .

 

In The Metadata

 

Sony is selling its Gracenote business to Tribune Co. for $170 million, according to Bloomberg, as it tries to streamline its business. The software is mainly used by companies like Apple and Amazon as a recognition service, but could be used to serve targeted ads on TVs. "Together we will become an even greater force in the global entertainment data business," Shashi Seth, president of Tribune Digital Ventures, said in the statement. Read more on Bloomberg <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001e0IymLCAx88VJVSZBm6Rj2fn367leoIpd1VQK4LaoFvA5I1xFkqn3Qe7Pl7rKaS-6QotyTrfMbSgHif-6CfoRbefefL2dO7A_OafwdKc_y9fFxYQ0-ATaTK15mLHGoSNk5PYwGD1rbDzQfOmEHNxxqbA2DSuN6aV6VRrzP17rfY8Qjl5dDf0d7K2oIzlgHkZfc6sBjnulTE9hrrtI7uzFmtgkWCRn8QQSJeg96QUHpk=> . And read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001e0IymLCAx8_m81CT0mmc_jGax2sICcKu8ivZYg3uTXq-H7ea1tkMAUhXC_XIQ40o9_KeO5WVNjsb07-n9AKGlfOh2Z8cMJiSVL924bHsoSPlqk8wGMR56H7-WKBWrljccXvMpYFA202a2ty3mKnhU5JpOvsfXd4qJddRGZ0iXq8C5xLx2FnkTVZscgsgViQSI7Z05dv1zC8=> .

 

China Deal

 

Apple has finally made a deal with the largest Chinese mobile carrier, China Mobile, that could potentially bring millions of new customers to the tech company. The Next Web reported that there could be some overhyping going on, though, as there are other networks in the country that carry iPhones. Add to that a high sticker price and it could be that Apple doesn't scoop up quite as many users as it hoped. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001e0IymLCAx8_BtO_V-VIS1rZMDco5Vs9BpM5RrAizSy_v3e3-tH02_I5dABRebr8Urd4A_fVA7RTA8OW2C7Xm46bg8rPaq06Tk_QuGcb6QXUlp9Px8Glhp9gOHiirrQVKlPLFLsK_jLS7JmZeXKUs0cKAMaBXXhqUd5a3n37SgOOZ6A4Cau0NeYcJcsYUNNja8jci8z4spu8QxU-AXfUz8FwsRPpBq5AV1gp1msJr5K7MrQuC1LtEWqWx4dcj0r2h> .

 

Funding Answers

 

Answers.com is on an upswing, raising $300 million and acquiring customer experience analytics company ForeSee, according to TechCrunch. The site relies on subscriptions for half of its revenue. The company hopes that by providing its Q&A service on other sites it can build a more dynamic platform as similar sites, such as Yahoo Answers, continue to lose popularity. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001e0IymLCAx88Xrl4VDHb-0OGKQDV_xnw_CC_xygkI2R_tvwYv8aYKXhckh81VNlWCEyqej7t7DQ2CYMi9Xx9Q5BxhcrB3kMAFAWU7Wq5SaNty9cuAId2F9M0lOEgfUglDvAk2Sg3tiEe-W8Z6yA2VZbqadKWL5FuHfDG63NDVABE8RpzvvCOuyPsWft6ht8Y5vc20apGfSx_yeNDbuOBCY82SAKaNgtPDLOyjJZcSfVn7YqF5ZYCzsMERFdONK_94iDNhasNiHwDR0yQY1nJs95SbZd2Z02dM> .

 

Publishers' Hall Of Shame

 

Publishers who use aggressive advertising tactics will be outed, or so finds Digiday's John McDermott, who rounded up several blogs that do just that. The blogs that McDermott highlights include Crapshaming, WTF Mobile Web and more. Stuffing your site with ads at the cost of the user experience tells readers "that the publisher simply places more value on being liked on Facebook than they do on their own content. This seems like a pretty good indicator to me that I'm not going to value the content on there either," Andy Beaumont, a self-proclaimed  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001e0IymLCAx88xdmPJpiL1dI0vSfOT6QT90cTTylTSLxDkFNXfCaByH38p0moeEGJwEfUTXvxAkdhDJeqyhg5P2fpKBOM1fGA7v7YRs0kszMfEQk4NJ1F3Puhj1vuQ2Xkg> "angry adman" and creative technology director at Albion London, tells McDermott. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001e0IymLCAx89aI5CU0re5DM-B2au2Z0YPEcP_m1bQT1NLRdGxxsOEe6DVhlQ2ckr2pZPRCggx2OkyqrjGMZrZ2hN6hHFEfzpKanCV4uykEMuX-UT8wP2kXzDCkpTm_NEtl1Sn04xtFd3v6PwGK3AtGFmpkyvDOwcYVlrKzopKIq0oiKGwQGjmEQ==>
